title: Colour for a dream
content:
I didn’t want to spend too much time deciding the colour for this site so this what I did.

I went to google, asked for ‘color palette’ and end up on http: //www.color-hex.com, now the amount of colour pallets here are… a lot! So to choose from ‘a lot’ takes time, and I already decided that I didn’t want to spend more time on this, and because I knew I had to wright about this process as well!

So my first thought was, ‘time to use the Google colors’, and that’s why I picked the ‘Cappuccino Color Palette’ http: //www.color-hex.com/color-palette/389

To keep things clean I created a new CSS file to use this pallet colours. And then I thought of change it… you know, the color pallet, so I pick some of them and made a drop box list of some templates, each one is connected to a css file and on selection it change the href value of my css link tag!

It’s cool, check the code... and I did somtheing similar with the layout :)

title: Handle my Data
content:
So how am I handle the blog post data? Well, basically with a JSON file, I just call the data of the file with javascript and send it to an html div for you to read. Now, the process of how I am updating the JSON file needs to be simplified, right this is what I do:

  1. Open some text editor and write my three fields of the post (title, date and content)
  2. I can use markup language on the content so to do that really fast I’m using the site wordtohtml.net
  3. Then I have to update the JSON file on my repository with my new data

This can be simplified, just need to think of a better way, one thing that I want to do is to combine steps1 and2 for now, I’ll have to search for a way on how to do that.

title: Hello World!
content:
Hello everyone, this is the first blog post! I'm still thinking on how I'm going to do this, I know that a CMS like 'Wordpress' should be my first choice but I'm trying to code this my way, with vanilla 'javascript', I'll also try to avoid any 'javascript' library.

So let's see what it can be done, and how will I do it. All the site code can be found on git here and you can use it at your own risk :) My goal is to explain, as simpler as possible, how I did this site, my code and info web sources, how I solved several of my daily challenges, and more…

So stay tuned… although I don't know how you will do that, I'll probably use twitter or email. What do you think?
